result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:57 PM Defendant JULIE A NOWAK in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared by video for JULIE A NOWAK.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, mirrors the criminal complaint and emails a copy to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 2:50 PM
Return date scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Return date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

1:34 PM Defendant JULIE A NOWAK in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for JULIE A NOWAK.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF82 & 2022CM90. Court goes over the competency report filed. Court questions the defendant is she is competent. Statement by the defendant, states she is competent.

Craig Schoenecker sworn, direct by ADA Mcelroy. Goes over qualifications. ADA McElroy offers the testimony of Dr. Schoenecker to the Court. Atty Kapelis has no objection. Court will allow. Testimony given. ADA offers exhibit #1 - competency report by Craig Schoenecker. No objection by Atty kapelis. Court receives exhibit #1. Cross exam by Atty Kapelis. No re-direct. Statement by defendant. 

Court finds the defendant not competent but will regain competency. Court commits the defendant to DHS and does not grant any pre-commitment credit. Court remands the defendant to the custody of the sheriff's department.

Court adjourned at 2:08 PM
State's Supplement to Original Motion to Allow Audiovisual Testimony
Motion for Video Testimony

10:53 AM Defendant JULIE A NOWAK in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for JULIE A NOWAK.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF82 & 2022CM90. Sattement by the Court - report finds the defendant not competent and likely to regain competency. Statement by Atty Kapelis - has received the report and defendant is contesing the findings. State is in agreement with the doctor's report. Doctor can appear via zoom. Atty Kapelis states they requests the doctor to appear in person. Statement by the Court - if able, doctor is to appear in person unless of time restraints.

Court adjourned at 10:56 AM

Atty Kapelis to submit something in regards to the defendant's proper name so the case name can be changed.  Court sets for competency hearing on June 21, 2022 at 1:30 PM (1/2 hr)

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

Defendant must take all medications as prescribed. Def can't go to the hospital unless she has an appointment or there is an emergency. Def must comply with all conditions set by her social worker. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns in Berlin.

Defendant must take all medications as prescribed. Def can't go to the hospital unless she has an appointment or there is an emergency. Def must comply with all conditions set by her social worker. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns in Berlin.

9:15 AM Defendant JULIE A NOWAK in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF82 and 22CM90. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives their reading. Court finds probable cause on 22CM90. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count on each case. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Statement by def's case manager. Court orders a competency evaluation for the defendant. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets both bonds at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant must take all medications as prescribed. Def can't go to the hospital unless she has an appointment or there is an emergency. Def must comply with all conditions set by her social worker. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns in Berlin. Court will set Status Hearing for June 14, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Court finds probable cause and extends the time limits as the competency was ordered.

Court adjourned at 9:20 AM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
